SourcedStatement: To learn more about having a child tested or to schedule a free test, contact your child’s pediatrician, call the Shelby County Health Department at 901-222-9582 or email them at sch.clppp@shelbycountytn.gov.
Name: Shelby County Health Department

SourcedStatement: To have your home tested, call the Shelby County Lead Hazard Control program at 901-222-7605 or the City of Memphis Lead-Safe program at 901-636-5323.
Name: Shelby County Lead Hazard Control program

SourcedStatement: Over 75% of the homes in both ZIP codes were built before 1980, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Name: U.S. Census Bureau
Justification: according to the U.S. Census Bureau

SourcedStatement: In South Memphis, for instance, about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Name: U.S. Census Bureau
Justification: according to the U.S. Census Bureau

SourcedStatement: Kids in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown.

Justification: Kids in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown. And children in Arlington are much better off than their counterparts in North Memphis.
